fields.description: seems to be broken by HIVE-15680

comments.body: fyi: [~erwaman]
Hi [~kgyrtkirk], could you include an example stack trace of or a link to a test failure?

there are output differences;
jenkins is unreachabel right now, but see any recent builds at https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HIVE-Build/ once its available
[~erwaman] could you please check these result set differences caused by HIVE-15680?
[~kgyrtkirk], can you just run the tests after reverting HIVE-15680 to see if that fixes the tests?

[~erwaman] don't be offended; but have *you* checked it?
I've bisected this problem prior to opening this ticket - then you let a whole week just pass...without answering my last comment
but sure...I can show it that you patch have broken that test: https://travis-ci.org/kgyrtkirk/hive/builds/344666807

believe me: I hate hunting down test failures not caused by myself...
[~kgyrtkirk], thanks for sharing that link. I'll take a closer look this weekend and try to fix the problem.
sure; but if the problem still persist on monday; I'm afraid I've to revert your patch ; we're already fully loaded with broken tests...

[~erwaman]: Thank you for looking into it! From your description I think that thing should be handled in a separate ticket...
Can you add a patch to disable ppd or something for this accumulo test (to prevent incorrect results); and leave a note in the new ticket about that in HIVE-18802 ?
[~kgyrtkirk], I didn't see an easy way to fix this test without breaking HIVE-15680, so for now, I think the easiest solution is to just revert the entire HIVE-15680 patch.

Reverting HIVE-15680 can cause correctness issues with PPD + MR.
[~erwaman]
Is this caused by underlying bug in PPD or AccumuloStorageHandler or elsewhere ?
From the comments above, it seems like a AccumuloStorageHandler bug where it seems to depend on PPD having been done ( I haven't done a deeper investigation, which would be necessary to confirm).

I think we should disable TestAccumuloCliDriver.testCliDriver[accumulo_queries] and track the issue via HIVE-18802 

cc [~elserj]

bq.  From the comments above, it seems like a AccumuloStorageHandler bug where it seems to depend on PPD having been done ( I haven't done a deeper investigation, which would be necessary to confirm).

If memory serves me, yes, the storage handler is expecting that PPD (which I'm reading as predicate pushdown, but am honestly not positive that's what the acronym is ;)) happens. Accumulo has a server-side computation layer in which we take some operands from the Hive query and can push them into Accumulo for efficiency's sake. Nothing more than filters is happening now (e.g. {{key == 1}} and {{key == 2}} in the above query), again, if memory serves. Is there some new kind of API which the storage handlers can look at to figure out when PPD is going to happen (or not)? That would have serious correctness issues if not..

[~erwaman], I'm confused on the phrasing: does HIVE-18802 apply both before and after HIVE-15680? I think you're saying that it was an existing problem, but it would also fix the test failures that HIVE-15680 caused?
I've attached a patch which disables ppd in that test

ATTACHMENT ID: 12912123 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

[~elserj]
{quote}bq.[~erwaman], I'm confused on the phrasing: does HIVE-18802 apply both before and after HIVE-15680? I think you're saying that it was an existing problem, but it would also fix the test failures that HIVE-15680 caused?
{quote}
Yes, the bug reported in HIVE-18802 happens with or without the changes made in HIVE-15680. I take back what I said about fixing HIVE-18802 also fixing HIVE-15680. I think they are related but slightly different bugs. With HIVE-18802, I think there's something funky going on with the way AccumuloStorageHandler is handling predicate pushdown.
+1 (non-binding – I am not a Hive committer) on your patch, [~kgyrtkirk]

Thanks for the clarification, [~erwaman]. Would definitely be good to know if there is something wrong.

Illl see if I can get my local environment set up again in the near future to poke at HIVE-18802.
pushed to master. Thank you Anthony and Thejas for reviewing the changes!
This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
